main event: A bright light, comparable in intensity to a bright star, was observed moving in Bellflower, California in January 1953 and January 1963.
interesting points: The object moved from a position slightly west of south to slightly east of south, increasing in elevation and moving away from the observer., The sighting was reported for approximately two minutes., Observers used a small telescope to view the object., There were multiple reports of similar sightings in the days surrounding the main events., Analysis of the sightings concluded they were probably astronomical phenomena, like satellites.
witness description: Mr., Age 50, Probation Officer, Los Angeles County
